Hi,
   The first place to do modifications is in the cti or ctml input file=
s
for your application. However, let's assume there is a reason why you
don=
't want to make modifications to the reaction rates there.

   For the kine=
tics objects, there is a member function in the base
kinetics class:
      =
 kinetics::setMultiplier(int I, double f)
which allows you to specify an ar=
bitrary multiplier for each reaction
rate coefficient.
This functionality i=
s used in sensitivity calculations.

There is no corresponding multiplier f=
unctions for diffusivities, as
sensitivities calculations for diffusivities=
 isn't a hot issue. You
might want to adjust the lennard-jones parameteriza=
tions in the input
file to get the diffusivities that you want (assuming yo=
ur application
involves a gas phase). Unfortunately, there is no transport =
class,
perhaps called ConstTransport(), that lets you assign constant trans=
port
properties at this time. However, I'll be looking at putting in a liqu=
id
phase transport class in the near future, and I guess I can put such a
c=
lass in.

Best wishes,
Harry Moffat
